key_title: Key to the species of Hypolepis

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants
Key to the genera of Dennstaedtiaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Sporangia protected by well-developed, reflexed, at least partially membranous flap
Sporangia unprotected, or partially protected by a slightly reflexed, green segment of the lamina
Hairs present in sorus; glandular hairs always absent from frond
Hairs absent from sorus; glandular hairs usually present on frond
Stipe mostly yellow-brown, 3–10 mm diam.; lamina 4-pinnate, 45–200 cm long and 40–150 cm broad, densely covered in fine colourless glandular hairs
Stipe mostly red-brown, 1–5 mm diam.; lamina 3-pinnate (rarely 4-pinnate), 15–115 cm long and 10–60 cm broad, sparsely covered in stout, colourless or red-brown hairs
Lamina narrowly triangular (2–3 times as long as broad), 15–75 cm long and 10–35 cm broad, bearing mostly colourless hairs on underside; pinnule lobes usually rounded
Lamina broadly triangular (1–1.5 times as long as broad), 35–115 cm long and 20–60 cm broad, bearing both colourless and red-brown hairs on underside; pinnule lobes acute to wedge-shaped
